### getInliningBonus() {#ac4efa89d9e0252ca071353280d22f52a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned FunctionSpecializer::getInliningBonus (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/argument">Argument</a> &#42; A, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42; C)</>}>
Compute the inlining bonus for replacing argument <code>A</code> with constant <code>C</code>.

The below heuristic is only concerned with exposing inlining opportunities via indirect call promotion. If the argument is not a (potentially casted) function pointer, give up.

### isArgumentInteresting() {#ad465572d3cfff885dc1e3bfaaf206594}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool FunctionSpecializer::isArgumentInteresting (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/argument">Argument</a> &#42; A)</>}>
